title.narrative: PlantwisePlus

description.narrative: The programme will deliver processes and tools that will achieve: (1) Pest Preparedness - to strengthen detection and response to pest outbreaks, to support countries with more consistent and coordinated mechanisms to detect, identify and respond to plant health problems; (2) Farmer Advisory - to deliver digital advisory tools to boost sustainable agriculture and improve the capacity of public and private actors providing support to smallholder famers to diagnose crop health problems and recommend sustainable solutions; (3) Pesticide Risk Reduction - to enhance the use of low-risk plant protection solutions to reduce reliance on high-risk farm inputs that have adverse effects on human health and biodiversity, and promoting the demand for safer and locally produced food.

To respond to the needs of farmers and the systems that support them, PlantwisePlus will help countries to Predict, Prevent and Prepare themselves for plant health threats - reducing crop losses. Recognising three key remaining challenges following implementation of Plantwise and Action on Invasives, it will more comprehensively support countries and farmers to produce the quantity of food required and also to improve the quality of food grown, in a changing climate.

participating-org.narrative: Australian Government - Australian Centre for International Agricultural Research (ACIAR)
Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs of the People's Republic of China
Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC)
UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office

provider-org.narrative: UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office
Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands
Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC)
UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office

title.narrative: PlantwisePlus Annual Donor Report 2021
Output 1.1 - Digitally supported PlantwisePlus Toolkit developed to facilitate implementation of sustainable and safer plant health practices
OutP_1.1-1 - Toolkit of tools developed and accessible for key users in each country

comment.narrative: Milestone: 1 tool of Toolkit in 8 countries
BioProtection Portal, Plantwise Knowledge Bank, Factsheet app. Milestone: BioProtection Portal launched in 16 new countries

title.narrative: Output 1.5 - Improved provision of gender sensitive agricultural extension services
OutP_1.5-2 - Number of women farmers accessing extension advice

comment.narrative: Milestone: 100,000 women farmers reached through service providers
Milestone: 112,481 women reached through service providers associated with the Plantwise programme

title.narrative: Output 1.3 - Training and digital learning products created to support capacity building of agricultural service providers

comment.narrative: Feasibility Report
Feasibility Report

title.narrative: OutP_1.3-1 - Existing digital learning and other training products ready for roll-out in local languages to agricultural service providers

comment.narrative: Milestone: 3 learning and training products rolled out in English, one of which also in Spanish
Milestone: Crop Pest Diagnosis (English/Spanish); Crop Pest Management (English); COLEACP collaboration course (English)

title.narrative: OutP_1.3-3 - New digital learning products developed on the basis of existing course materials (e.g. use of natural enemies in sustainable agriculture)

comment.narrative: Number of Modules. Milestone: Digital learning content developed for 4 courses

Number of Modules - 10 online course modules created, plus 13 updated from Crop Pest Diagnosis and Crop Pest Management online courses. Milestone: 2 CAS courses on ICM developed; online PRA course developed in collaboration with COLEACP; 3rd CAS course to be completed early 2022

comment.narrative: Target to be determined, therefore currently recorded as zero pending further information on this indicator. Milestone: New or existing decision support tools and processes used to prioritise invasive species for monitoring and management in 2 countries.

Too early to state number, therefore currently recorded as zero pending further information. Milestone: Horizon Scanning tools used in Kenya and Pakistan to prioritize 25 species for PRA (9 in Pakistan, 16 in Kenya).
